alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Lexington; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Fairfield, east central Lexington, northwestern Sumter, Richland and southwestern Kershaw Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Springdale to Woodfield to Cayce. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, West Columbia, Cayce, Forest Acres, Camden, Springdale, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Shaw Air Base, McEntire Air Base, St. Andrews, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Eastover, Lugoff, Oakland, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, and SC State Fair Grounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 2 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 72 and 98. Interstate 26 between mile markers 110 and 119. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 28, and near mile marker 33. Winds of 45 mph and pea sized hail have already been reported with this line of thunderstorms. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
